title: [威士忌]Glenfarclas 105
content:
https://i.imgur.com/ndxrh1M.jpg

Glenfarclas, the most dominant distillery in Scotland which has almost complete years of aging casks. Since Glenfarclas has such abundant collection of aged whiskies, we have the chance to try them straight up to 60 years in a row. They also has the famous series of “The Family Cask. “
As for this non-age-statement (NAS) whisky, I keep it just for experiment. Rumor has it tasting notes will change in cask strength whiskies, so I bought this and try it every month. So far, I found this one becoming more acceptable compare to my first try. However, this whisky is just to young, it had not enough time to thrive in cask. After all it is just a 3-year-aging “kid. “
.
105, 60% abv, cask strength, natural color, non chill-filtered
.
Color: gold to copper
Nosing: strong, alcoholic, unripened green apple, citrus, oakiness shows up after diluting with distilled water
Palating: intense, young and immature alcoholic notes, too much oak wood flavour, end up with unpleasant spiciness
Aftertaste: long, bitter and hints of tannin lingering tongue base, dryness 
.
.
As for the number 105. In old Scotland, the amount of alcohol content was measured in specific rule. They defined 57% abv as 100, once the abv percentage increased in 3%, the number goes up in 5. So this Glenfarclas is 60% abv, equals to 105. Though this measuring rule was no longer available nowadays, they keep this number ”105” to commemorate old time traditions.
